discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"Customer 10" is a typo, it's "Customer ID" and then it's the right answer.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

questions.question_text:
A Marketing Cloud admin is configuring the Marketing Cloud data model for the first time. Journey Builder will be used to personalize the type of messages being sent to customers, based on if there has been an order or not. There are two existing data extensions: Customers and Orders.
‘Customers’ contains information about subscribers including Email Address, First Name, Last Name, Address, and Customer ID.
‘Orders’ contains information about the orders and includes the unique identifier of the customer.
How should Data Designer be configured to allow this data to be used within a Journey decision split?

choices.A: Link the Customers data extension to the data model using a Many-to-One relationship.
choices.B: Link the Customers data extension to the data model using Email Address.
choices.C: Link the Customers data extension to the data model using Customer 10.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When you set up an event notification, it automatically triggers when a failure occurs

questions.question_text:
A Marketing Cloud admin has scheduled a query on a daily basis. They notice the query sometimes fails to execute.
How would the admin ensure a notification is received when the query fails?

choices.A: Verify their Email Address in Alert Manager within the Setup app
choices.C: Configure the “Event Notification Service” in Setup with their Email Address
choices.B: Add their Email Address in the automation notification settings

The file is "imported". Therefore it can't be on any (S)FTP afterwards because it's pulled into SFMC, the so called "Safehouse".

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters placed an encrypted file on their Marketing Cloud SFTP for import into a data extension. They are using a File Transfer Activity to decrypt the file.
Where would the decrypted data be after the File Transfer Activity completes?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

questions.question_text:
A Marketing Cloud admin is setting up Northern Trail Outfitters’ newest business units and several users to the new business units.
How would the admin assign users to the business units?

choices.A: Search for the individual user, select their name, and click Manage Business Units.
choices.B: Search for the individual user, select their name, and click Edit Business Units.
choices.C: Give permissions to users at the top-level account to assign their own business units.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
https://www.salesforce.com/products/marketing-cloud/sfmc/sms-ratio-updates/
ultipliers differ based on your Edition or Product, subscription start date, destination country and message type.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

choices.A: Each email consumes five Super Messages when sending below a certain threshold.
choices.B: MobilePush was enabled by mistake, which consumes Super Messages when not in use.
choices.C: A multiplier is applied to each SMS message based on the destination country.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) rolled out a global SMS initiative three months ago, as their customers have shown great interest in receiving promotions via text. However, NTO was notified they are already at 75% utilization for their annual Super Messages.
Why could this be the case?
